alert.note: Alert for Imperial (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 20 at 3:06PM PDT until August 20 at 6:30PM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... West Central Yuma County in southwestern Arizona... Southwestern La Paz County in west central Arizona... Eastern Imperial County in southeastern California... * Until 630 PM MST /630 PM PDT/. * At 306 PM MST /306 PM PDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Holtville, Algodones Dunes, Gordon`s Well, Andrade, Cibola, Palo Verde, Calipatria, Slab City, Glamis, Wiest, Alamorio, Bonds Corner and Niland. This includes the following streams and drainages... Senator Wash, Hemlock Canal, South Alamo Canal, Araz Wash, Crazy Woman Wash, Gavilan Wash, Little Picacho Wash, West Fork Yuma Wash, Iris Wash, Alamo River, Unnamed Wash, Carrizo Wash, Lopez Wash, Mission Wash, Ferguson Wash, McAllister Wash, Milpitas Wash, Yuma Wash, Hart Mine Wash, Marcus Wash, Clip Wash, Julian Wash, Picacho Wash, Vinagre Wash, Colorado River and Seco, Arroyo. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
